Package main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.objects

Class Email

java.lang.Object
main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.objects.Email
All Implemented Interfaces:
Info
public class Email extends Object implements Info
This object contains the info for a finnish ID and methods to manipulate that data.
Author:
Tuukka Rintala

  • Constructor Details

    • Email

      public Email()
      This constructor is used for creating empty Email objects.

    • Email

      public Email(String startInfo)
      This is a constructor which recieves its information in the argument. The information is stored using setInfo, so that it is validated and throws an exception if the data is invalid.
      Parameters:
      startInfo - a String containing an email.

  • Method Details

    • getInfo

      public String getInfo()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to get the information that is stored onto a text file from this object. The method is used specifically to store data from this object into a text file, so it should be validated and stored in a way that will not cause errors when importing it later.
      Specified by:
      getInfo in interface Info
      Returns:
      a String containing contact information that is formatted in a way that can be read by this program.

    • setInfo

      public void setInfo(String newInfo)
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to be able to change the information in the object while validating it. The method should be implemented such that each time new information is stored it is validated, and throws an error if invalid and non-optional, otherwise we risk storing invalidly formatted data in the text file.
      Specified by:
      setInfo in interface Info
      Parameters:
      newInfo - is a String containing the information you wish to store.

    • validate

      public boolean validate(String info)
      This method validates if the argument is a correctly formatted email. A regular expression is compiled to check that the first or last character isn't a '.', the first part consists of letters or certain other characters(-_.), then there should be an @ character followed by letters and at least one dot followed by letters. It is then matched against the argument.
      Parameters:
      info - a String containing the email we wish to validate.
      Returns:
      a boolean denoting whether the argument was valid.

    • inputInfo

      public void inputInfo()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to get new information from the user and store it into this object. The method should get inputs from the user until we get a valid one if the information is non-optional. If it is optional, first ask the user if they wish to add this information.
      Specified by:
      inputInfo in interface Info

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to retrieve the information from the object in a way that can be displayed correctly in the console. This method is called when we wish to print this objects information into the console. This is relevant if the object contains more than one piece of information that need to be separated differently in the text file than the console.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface Info
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String containing the information from this object that can be displayed correctly.
